Degrees Offered at Regent University

Regent University appears in our ranking of the 50 Most Affordable Master’s in Theology Degree Programs Online.

At Regent University, students have a full range of accredited degree programs to choose from, including bachelor’s, master’s and doctoral programs that are available online and on campus. Regent University specializes in providing a Christian education, so students of divinity studies can find the learning resources they need for a successful experience. All degree programs at Regent University are fully accredited and designed to prepare students for careers in industries throughout the economy. Students are not required to take Christian courses unless they are enrolled in a divinity degree program. Several divinity degree programs are available online as well as on campus. Regent University is a renowned leader in Christian education, and graduates of the divinity program can find employment in Christian organizations throughout the world.

Undergraduates at Regent University can major in any subject in the liberal arts, fine arts, social sciences, natural sciences, healthcare occupations, and law professions. A four-year degree at Regent University requires about 120 credit hours of classroom time as well as a senior-year capstone project. Undergraduate students have access to excellent support resources on campus and on the website. Residential and online students can access learning resources online and on campus using a student ID. The mission of Regent University is to provide students with the tools and instruction they need to become leaders in their fields after graduation. With the quality and dedication of the faculty at Regent University, students can achieve their educational goals while discovering new ideas and experiences. From the College of Healthcare Sciences to the schools of government and law, the academic resources at Regent University are ranked among the best in the country.

Regent University is a top research facility with many premium graduate degree options for students pursuing careers in academia and industry. Master’s degrees at Regent University require two years of full-time enrollment to complete. Graduate degree programs may contain one or more capstone requirements, depending on the length of the program and the subject of research. All graduate students have the opportunity to perform professional-level academic research under the supervision of a tenured professor with expertise in his or her field of scholarship. The research conducted by graduate students with their professors is funded by the grants and endowments provided to the university by government allocations and other financial sources. It is exciting, cutting-edge research with real-world implications in industries of every academic discipline. From healthcare and social work to engineering and computer science, every department at Regent University has a top-tier research program. Each program prepares graduate students to contribute to a growing body of knowledge in their chosen discipline.

Students at Regent University can enroll in fully online degree programs as well as mixed-format programs. It is not always necessary to declare a major before enrolling in classes online, but some advanced courses require the completion of prerequisite courses. The bachelor’s degrees available online include Christian ministry, accounting, history, psychology, and other liberal arts degrees. The online master’s degrees include communications, media studies, film and television, theology, Christian ministry and several degrees in the humanities and social sciences. The doctorates available online include degrees in business, education, and Christian ministry. Regent University offers a large number of non-degree certificates in teaching, healthcare, Christian ministry, and other disciplines. A choice of eight-week or 15-week courses is available for each degree program.

About Regent University

Regent University is a Christian university that was founded in 1977 by Pat Robertson in Virginia Beach, VA. It educates approximately 8,000 to 9,000 students per year through online and on-campus degree programs. Every year, Regent University awards around 1,900 to 2,000 degrees in all, with around 600 bachelor’s degrees, 1,000 master’s degrees and 200 doctoral degrees being granted for all program types. Students at Regent University are not required to be practicing Christians, but the education at Regent University is based in Christianity. Since 1977, the mission of Regent University has been to educate college students with the highest standards of academic excellence available at the university level. Students who graduate from Regent University gain valuable experience and insight into the work they do after leaving college.

Regent University Accreditation Details

The Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges (SACSCC) has approved Regent University to award baccalaureate and graduate degrees to residential and online students. The SACSCC is a regional accrediting commission that specializes in auditing residential colleges in the southern United States. Many departments at Regent University are separately accredited through institutions such as the Teacher Education Accreditation Council (TEAC), the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (CCNE), the American Psychological Association (APA) and others. Accreditation must be renewed every 10 years to ensure that university facilities continue to provide the high quality required of them by the accrediting bodies.

Regent University Application Requirements

Regent University is a small, selective private college that admits students based on grades, educational experience, accomplishments and a writing sample in the form of an essay. Students have the best chance of being admitted if they can show good study habits and a positive influence in their communities. Incoming freshmen, transfer students, and graduate students can apply online by submitting an application along with school transcripts and exam scores. Undergraduate applicants must include a high school transcript or proof of a GED with their applications. Graduate applicants must include an official college transcript showing proof of a bachelor’s degree. Applicants for doctoral programs may need to show proof of a master’s degree before enrollment.
